terrain_conditions: Desert - Coastal Libya, extreme heat, water scarcity
weather_impact: High temperatures reducing vehicle performance and increasing water consumption. Sand affecting weapons and vehicle maintenance.

validation.tier: Tier 1 - Primary source (Nafziger Collection 941IKAB November 1941) + Tier 2 web sources
sources: Nafziger Collection 941IKAB - Italian 'Trieste' Motorized Division, 1 November 1941 (PDF)
TME 30-420 Italian Military Forces (US War Department, August 1943) - Paragraph 56 Motorized Division
Web search: Alessandro Piazzoni command dates (military-history.fandom.com, Wikipedia)
Web search: Trieste Division North Africa deployment August 1941
notes: November 1941 Nafziger data used as proxy for Q3 (July-September 1941) - division arrived Libya August 1941, organization stable through fall 1941
Commander: Alessandro Piazzoni (10 September 1940 - 10 December 1941) confirmed via web sources
Artillery: 36 field (24x 75/27, 12x 100/17), 12 medium (12x 105/28 IX Group joined June 1941), 40 AA (32x 20mm, 8x 75mm), 48 AT (36x 47/32, 12x 65/17)
Vehicles: 850 trucks (Fiat/Lancia/Alfa Romeo), 18 armored cars (AB 40/41), 320 motorcycles (Moto Guzzi/Benelli/Gilera)

Infantry: 65th Regiment (2 motorized battalions + heavy battalion), 66th Regiment (2 motorized battalions + heavy battalion), 9th Bersaglieri Regiment (XXXII Motorcycle Bn, XXVIII Motorized Bn, XXX Motorized Bn, XL Heavy Support Bn)
Support: 51st Mixed Engineer Battalion (LII), Divisional Medical Section (90th, 177th, 242nd Field Hospitals), 176th Supply Section, 25th Bakery Squadron, 80th Mixed Vehicle Repair Group
Tanks: 0 (Motorized infantry division - no organic armor)
Deployment: Arrived North Africa August 1941, deployed to Tobruk siege sector by September 1941
Q3 1941 context: Pre-Operation Crusader, summer extreme heat (25-45°C), desert logistics challenges
Supply: 5 days fuel, 7 days ammo, 4 days water reserves (desert environment), 200km operational radius
Schema v3.1.0 FLAT structure: All top-level fields, tanks object has only numbers, supply/environment at top level
